The Buzz | Gunnar Deatherage on 'Runway'

Louisville designer is back in all-star 'Project Runway' premiering Thursday

The Buzz | Gunnar Deatherage on 'Runway'

Kirby Adams, The Courier-Journal 11:20 a.m. EDT October 28, 2014

Louisville designer Gunnar Deatherage will be competing again starting Thursday on Lifetimes Project Runway. (Photo: Steve Squall )

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

This season of Lifetime's "Project Runway All Stars" premieres at 9 p.m. Thursday and features Louisville's Gunnar Deatherage. The local designer tells The Buzz this season is " really entertaining and more about the fashion and less about personality conflicts."

Deatherage placed eighth during Season 10 of the show. Besides Deatherage, 13 other standout designers were asked to return to New York to make up the all-star cast.

Deatherage spent late spring and this summer in New York for the taping of the upcoming season of "Project Runway." Thanks to his television celebrity, Deatherage says he's gotten incredible opportunities and learned a great deal about the fashion industry. "I've also received some odd requests, like being asked to design tassels for strippers," which he says he declined.

Back home in the Bluegrass, Deatherage continues his work as creative director for NFocus Magazine and has been busy creating two clothing lines.

MORE BUZZ: Fitz and The Tantrums in Louisville

His "everyday" ready-to-wear line is called "Deatherage Designs" and will be available to the public online starting at 9 p.m. Thursday to coincide with the season premiere of the TV show. He says the line is "soft and easy to wear," and is priced in the $65-$240 range. Check it out at gunnardeatherage.com.

His second line, "destination HYDRA," is couture and "space travel" inspired. Deatherage says it will be available online in the "not so distant" future early November.

Want to watch the premiere with the designer? Deatherage tells The Buzz there will be a viewing party at Nowhere Bar, 1133 Bardstown Road, beginning at 8 p.m. Thursday.

Have an idea for a Buzz item? Send it to Kadams@courier-journal.com and be sure to follow me on Twitter @kirbylouisville.
